input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Ability to speak english has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Smoking has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Diabetes has a direct effect on lifespan. Smoking is unobserved. We know that speaking english or smoker causes having diabetes. speaking english and smoker and having diabetes causes long lifespan. We observed the person is a smoker. Would the person has a short lifespan if speaking english instead of not speaking english?
